text: Uttambhai Nathalal Mehta (1923 - 1998) was an Indian businessman, the founder and chairman of Torrent Group. Mehta was born in Mehmadpur village in Palanpur district, India. He graduated from Bombay's Wilson College. He started his career as a medical representative for the pharmaceutical company Sandoz in the 1940s. Mehta and his wife Shardaben, had four children, sons Sudhir and Samir, and daughters Meena and Nayna. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Indian businesspeople Category:Indian company founders Category:Indian chairmen of corporations Category:People from Banaskantha district Category:20th-century businesspeople
